comments:
I was just playng around with 1.0M9 and i stumbled in the following scenario, that in my opinion shows several problems:
(i hope i choose the right component)

1- create a new dynamic web project
2- from properties/java build path remove src as source folder, add src/java folder and make it the source folder for the project.
3- first problem, the .component still contains <wb-resource deploy-path="/WEB-INF/classes" source-path="/src"/>, and Project explorer still shows /src as source path while Package explorer correctly upadates to /src/java
4- now you have several options, just start adding something to the webContents dir or close/open the project (by the way closing the project makes it disappearing from the Project explorer)
5- sometimes happens immediately, sometimes it takes longer but at the end i get the project marked in error and the following message in the problems view: "Cannot nest 'projectName/src/java' inside library 'projectName/src'"
6- to get rid of this error i have to manually change .component 
<wb-resource deploy-path="/WEB-INF/classes" source-path="/src"/> 
into
<wb-resource deploy-path="/WEB-INF/classes" source-path="/src/java"/>
than stop/start eclipse, but suppose instead i delete the project asking to remove contents and ensure that everything is cleaned up
7- from Project explorer i then make a new Dynamic web project with the same name. Project dirs and contents are buit then bang:

8- if instead, after deleting i stop/start eclipse i'm able to recreate the project without problems.
Chuck, this one might be for you.
The navigator gets out of synch it seems only when the new source folder is nested under the old one.  This would seem to limit how mainstream this scenario is.

A fix for the UI piece in the J2EE nav is dropped to the RC2 driver for 1207.    The workaround for the other issue is to first delete the src folder from the navigator.  Then, open propeties and add src/java.  Then, you will not have a build error, you can delete the project and readd and it will add appropriately.  This is also only an issue because the new src folder is nested under the existing one.  Other cases work fine.

Reassigning to Robert Frost because he added some code to automatically fix the .components file on changing the src folder, however it doesn't seem to be handling this case properly as the old src folder still exists.

Just checked the scenario and my logic was correctly replacing:

 <wb-resource source-path="/src" deploy-path="/WEB-INF/classes"/>

with:

<wb-resource source-path="/src/java" deploy-path="/WEB-INF/classes"/>

however, I am seeing the following errors:
-"Cannot nest 'web/src/java' inside library 'web/src'" error
-Project Explorer out-of-sync error (John: I sync'd to jst.j2ee.navigator.ui and jst.j2ee.ui - which plugins do I need for your fix?)
-the error in #7

The "cannot nest" error seems suspiciously like a JDT bug, however, I was unable to replicate on a plain Java project - I'm happy to own but am going to change the milestone since, without a better understanding of what's happening here, a fix for RC2 is not likely to happen.

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.jdt.core 4 977 2005-12-06 16:09:25.593

Note: this failure results in a *facet.core.xml file for the dynamic web project that is missing the entry  "<installed facet="jst.web" version="2.4"/>"
hmmm, forget my unnecessary addition of the stack that was already in the original bug - must be tired :)

Ok, had a chance to look at this again; I think the relevant error is the nested cp entry error and it is due to a clash between these two entries:

<classpathentry kind="src" path="src/java"/>
<classpathentry kind="con" path="org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.web.container"/>

The "org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.web.container" classpath container resolves to the "source-paths" for the wb-resource entries for /WEB-INF/lib and /WEB-INF/classes and /WEB-INF/classes initially resolves to "src".

If the J2EEElementChangeListener is not enabled, you won't get the nested error right away, however, you will get it the first time a build is executed; with the change listener, a build is executed when it updates the .component file to fix the wb-resource element to reflect the cp entry change; the problem is that the WebAppContainer (or the virtual component logic called by it) is not picking up the change to the .component file when the container entry is resolved during the build (probably because it is handling updates using POST_CHANGE events rather than PRE_BUILD events - note: a subsequent build-triggering change will remove the error) - Konstantin: sending you way for the fix to the container class resource listening logic.
I am unclear as to repro steps. Rob, could you document the steps you took to reproduce what you were seeing in your comments. What code line were you using?

I had followed the original repro steps (using a 1.0 build from Dec); this scenario should definitely be tested again to see if the underlying problem still exists (a large number of changes have been made since it was reported to the relevant logic).
I am unable to repro with 1.5 RC4; Gabriele, please reopen if you are still hitting this problem.
